definition: to engulf/to sweep/to carry away everything
surname Xi
woven mat/seat/banquet/place in a democratic assembly/classifier for banquets, conversations etc
to roll (up)/to sweep up/to carry on/roll

sentences.english: Soul of a force on the storm, swept the continent magic peak.
sentences.chinese: 一切關於魂力的風暴，席捲大陸的幻術巔峯。

sentences.english: The big clean-out that sweeps across China north began.
sentences.chinese: 席捲華北的大掃蕩開始了。

sentences.english: Hong Kong actor HIV Y rumors, has recently swept the entertainment industry.
sentences.chinese: 香港Y男星艾滋傳聞，最近正席捲娛樂界。

sentences.english: Its been ten years since i last visited, a little nostalgia swept over me.
sentences.chinese: 從我上次去那裏已經有十年了，懷舊感席捲了我。

sentences.english: These days the fever of learning English as young as possible has swept all over China.
sentences.chinese: 如今英語學習低齡化的熱潮已經席捲中國。

sentences.english: An easterly gale blew up, making the birds fly low.
sentences.chinese: 一陣席捲而來的東風使鳥飛低。
1970年代的時尚風正席捲着歐洲。

sentences.english: A sandstorm in a refugee camp near the border of Somalia.
sentences.chinese: 一場沙塵暴席捲了索馬里邊境附近的一個難民營。

sentences.english: The reform bandwagon swept across the country.
Dark clouds roll over Paria Canyon- Vermillion Cliffs Wilderness in Utah.
sentences.chinese: 烏雲向猶他州帕里亞峽谷的黃石公園席捲而來。

sentences.english: In the years that followed, a long-lasting Red Crag fever swept all of New China.
sentences.chinese: 隨後，一股紅巖熱在很長時間裏席捲了新中國。

sentences.english: The craze is sweeping over Japan.
Soul of a force on the storm, Swept the continent magic peak.
sentences.chinese: 壹場有關魂力地風暴，席捲大陸的幻術巔峯。

sentences.english: All the bad feelings of the morning rushed over her again.
sentences.chinese: 早上那些糟糕的感覺又向她席捲而來。

sentences.english: Severe storms also rolled through the Midwest.
sentences.chinese: 強風暴也席捲了美國中西部地區。

sentences.english: In January 1942, the Japanese war machines across southeast Asia early 1200s.
sentences.chinese: 1942年1月，日本戰爭機器的鐵蹄席捲東南亞。

definition: storm/violent commotion/fig. crisis (e.g. revolution, uprising, financial crisis etc)
fashionable/popular
whirlwind/tornado
to sweep away/to sweep across
tempest/wave (of popular sentiment etc)/craze or fad
fiery/blazing
to surge up violently (of ocean, river, lake etc)/turbulent
to be a big hit/to be hugely popular
lit. hiding the sky and covering the earth (idiom); fig. earth-shattering/omnipresent/of universal importance
hurricane
to surge like a gathering storm (idiom)/to grow by leaps and bounds
upsurge/popular craze
see 勢不可當|势不可当[shi4 bu4 ke3 dang1]
similar to/appearing to be
to whistle/to scream/to whiz
violent/acute/severe/fierce
